member.name: M:Unigine.Json.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor that creates an empty instance.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.#ctor(char)
member.summary: Constructor that creates a JSON node with a given name.
member.param: Name of the Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.setArray
member.summary: Sets the array type to the current Json node. This method can be called for a newly added node or for the existing node to change its type. However, in certain cases, this can lead to data loss. For example, if you change the type from object to array, names of the child nodes will be lost.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.isArray const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the Json node has an array type.
member.returns: 1 if the Json has an array type; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.setBool(int)
member.summary: Sets a boolean value and type to the current Json node.
member.param: Argument of one of the following types:string value - all strings except "true", set "false".int value - all int values except 0, set "true".double value - all double values except 0.0, set "true".float value - all float values except 0.0f, set "true".
Integer value.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.getBool const
member.summary: Reads a boolean value of the current Json node.
member.returns: 1 if the Json node has a bool type; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.isBool const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the Json node has a bool type.
member.returns: 1 if the Json has a bool type; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.getChild(int) const
member.summary: Returns the child node of the current Json node.
member.param: Argument of one of the following types:string name - Name of the Json node.int number - Number of the child of the Json node.
Argument of one of the following types:string name - Name of the Json node.int number - Number of the child of the Json node.
member.returns: Child Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.getChild(char) const
member.summary: Returns the child node of the current Json node.
member.param: Argument of one of the following types:string name - Name of the Json node.int number - Number of the child of the Json node.
member.returns: Child Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.isChild(char) const
member.summary: Checks if a child node with a given name exists.
member.param: Name of the child node.
member.returns: 1 if a child with the provided name exists; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.addChild(char,double,double)
member.summary: Adds a new name-value pair as a child node to the current Json node.
member.param: Node name.
Argument of one of the following types:int value - integer value.float value - float value.string value - string value.
Argument of one of the following types:int value - integer value.float value - float value.string value - string value.
Argument of one of the following types:Json json - Json node.string name - Name of the Json node.
member.returns: Child Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.addChild(char)
member.summary: Adds a new name-value pair as a child node to the current Json node.
member.param: Node name.
member.returns: Child Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.addChild(char,char)
member.summary: Adds a new name-value pair as a child node to the current Json node.
member.param: Node name.
Argument of one of the following types:int value - integer value.float value - float value.string value - string value.
member.returns: Child Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.addChild(Unigine.Ptr{Json})
member.summary: Adds a new name-value pair as a child node to the current Json node.
member.param: Node name.
Argument of one of the following types:int value - integer value.float value - float value.string value - string value.
Argument of one of the following types:Json json - Json node.string name - Name of the Json node.
member.returns: Child Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.addChild(char,int)
member.summary: Adds a new name-value pair as a child node to the current Json node.
member.param: Node name.
Argument of one of the following types:int value - integer value.float value - float value.string value - string value.
member.returns: Child Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.addChild
member.summary: Adds a child node to the current Json node.
member.returns: Child Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.getSubTree(char)
member.summary: Returns a subtree of a Json node as the non-formatted string.
member.param: The name of a child node. If there is a name, the function returns formatted subtree for this child Json node.
member.returns: Non-formatted subtree.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.getFormattedSubTree(char)
member.summary: Returns a subtree of a Json node as the formatted string.
member.param: The name of a child node. If there is a name, the function returns formatted subtree for this child Json node.
member.returns: Formatted subtree.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.setName(char)
member.summary: Sets the given name to the Json node.
member.param: Name of the Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.getName const
member.summary: Returns the name of the current Json node.
member.returns: The name of the Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.setNull
member.summary: Sets null type to the current Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.isNull const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the Json node has a null type.
member.returns: 1 if the Json has a null type; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.setNumber(double)
member.summary: Sets a number value and type to the current Json node.
member.param: Argument of one of the following types:int number - integer value. For example, 5.double number - double value. For example, 5.0.float number - float value. For example, 5.0f.string value - string with value. For example, "5".
Double value.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.getNumber const
member.summary: Returns the number value of the current Json node.
member.returns: Number value of the current Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.isNumber const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the Json node has a number type.
member.returns: 1 if the Json has a number type; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.getNumChildren const
member.summary: Returns the number of child nodes of the current Json node.
member.returns: Number of child nodes.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.setObject
member.summary: Sets object type to the current Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.isObject const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the Json node has an object type.
member.returns: 1 if the Json has an object type; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.getParent
member.summary: Returns the parent node of the current Json node.
member.returns: Parent Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.setString(char)
member.summary: Sets a string value and type to the current Json node. The function automatically casts number values to string type.
member.param: Argument of one of the following types:string value - string value.int number - integer value.double number - double value.float number - float value.
String value.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.getString
member.summary: Returns the value of the current Json node as string.
member.returns: Value of the current Json node

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.isString const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the Json node has a string type.
member.returns: 1 if the Json has a string type; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.clear
member.summary: Clears all data of the current Json node including type, value, name and all children. If the current Json node has a parent, it also removed from the parent Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.removeChild(Unigine.Ptr{Json})
member.summary: Removes the child Json node.
member.param: Argument of one of the following types:Json json - Json node.string name - Name of the Json node.
Argument of one of the following types:Json json - Json node.string name - Name of the Json node.
member.returns: Removed child Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.removeChild(char)
member.summary: Removes the child Json node.
member.param: Argument of one of the following types:Json json - Json node.string name - Name of the Json node.
member.returns: Removed child Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.clearChildren
member.summary: Clears all children of the current Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.copy(Unigine.Ptr{Json})
member.summary: Copies type, name and value from the source Json node to the current Json node and adds the source Json child nodes as child nodes to the current Json node.
member.param: Source Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.find(char)
member.summary: Finds Json node by its name in current Json node tree.
member.param: Name of the Json node.
member.returns: Founded Json node.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.load(char)
member.summary: Loads the data to the current Json node from the file with a given path.
member.param: Path of the file.
member.returns: 1 if the Json node was loaded successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.parse(char)
member.summary: Parses a given string into the Json node. Usage Example Now the json_2 node contains:
member.param: String to parse.
member.returns: 1 if the string was parsed successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.save(char) const
member.summary: Saves the Json node into a file with a given path. Creates the given file path if it doesnâ€™t exist yet (including subdirectories).
member.param: Path to the file.
member.returns: 1 if the file was saved successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.read(char) const

member.param: Name of the Json node.
member.returns: Node value

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.write(char,bool)
member.summary: Writes the specified boolean value to the target Json node with the specified name. In case such node is not found, a new one is added with the name specified.
member.param: Name of the target Json node.
Boolean value to be written to the Json node with the specified name.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.write(char,int)
member.summary: Writes the specified integer value to the target Json node with the specified name. In case such node is not found, a new one is added with the name specified.
member.param: Name of the target Json node.
Integer value to be written to the Json node with the specified name.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.write(char,unsignedint)
member.summary: Writes the specified unsigned integer value to the target Json node with the specified name. In case such node is not found, a new one is added with the name specified.
member.param: Name of the target Json node.
Unsigned integer value to be written to the Json node with the specified name.

member.name: M:Unigine.Json.write(char,char)
member.summary: Writes the specified character value to the target Json node with the specified name. In case such node is not found, a new one is added with the name specified.
member.param: Name of the target Json node.
